Pillar Description: An organization which grows food in-house, with this being their primary source of income.

An organization which aggregates fresh food, processing it and packaging it for consumption. This can also include processing the food from a raw material to another ingredient which is easier to sell, or for consumers to use.
An organization which sells or donates food to individuals, insititutions, or other consumers.
An organization which can produce food such that it can be served, as well as the individuals which can consume food which has been served.
An organization which can compost, reduce, reuse, or reclaim food waste for other purposes.
An organization which has the capacity to regulate or legislate food transport, food growth, food aggregation, food waste, or consumption.
An organization which promotes healthy food habits and educates the general public about the ways they should live to avoid diseases.
An organization which can help support the food system by making connections between different social enterprises.
An organization which has expertise in communicating with external stakeholders, the general public, and those most affected.
A volunteer unaffiliated with a particular organization, but interested in urban agriculture, food planning, and more.
